pullRequest.body:
Some lemmas in `Algebra.Order.GroupWithZero.Unbundled` have incorrect or unsatisfactory names, or assumptions that can be omitted using `ZeroLEOneClass`. The lemmas added in this PR are versions of existing lemmas that use the correct or better name or `ZeroLEOneClass` to omit an assumption. The original lemmas will be deprecated in #17593.

| New name                | Old name                |
|-------------------------|-------------------------|
| `mul_le_one_left₀`     | `Left.mul_le_one_of_le_of_le`   |
| `mul_lt_one_of_le_of_lt_left₀` (`0 ≤ ·` version) / `mul_lt_one_of_le_of_lt_of_pos_left`     | `Left.mul_lt_of_le_of_lt_one_of_pos`   |
| `mul_lt_one_of_lt_of_le_left₀`     | `Left.mul_lt_of_lt_of_le_one_of_nonneg`   |
| `mul_le_one_right₀`      | `Right.mul_le_one_of_le_of_le`       |
| `mul_lt_one_of_lt_of_le_right₀` (`0 ≤ ·` version) / `mul_lt_one_of_lt_of_le_of_pos_right`   | `Right.mul_lt_one_of_lt_of_le_of_pos`     |
| `mul_lt_one_of_le_of_lt_right₀`      | `Right.mul_lt_one_of_le_of_lt_of_nonneg`       |

The following lemmas use `ZeroLEOneClass`.

| New name                | Old name                |
|-------------------------|-------------------------|
| `(Left.)one_le_mul₀`      | `Left.one_le_mul_of_le_of_le`       |
| `Left.one_lt_mul_of_le_of_lt₀`  |   `Left.one_lt_mul_of_le_of_lt_of_pos`  |
| `Left.one_lt_mul_of_lt_of_le₀`  |   `Left.lt_mul_of_lt_of_one_le_of_nonneg` / `one_lt_mul_of_lt_of_le` (still there)     |
| `(Left.)one_lt_mul₀`      |     |
| `Right.one_le_mul₀`      | `Right.one_le_mul_of_le_of_le`       |
| `Right.one_lt_mul_of_lt_of_le₀`      | `Right.one_lt_mul_of_lt_of_le_of_pos`       |
| `Right.one_lt_mul_of_le_of_lt₀`     | `Right.one_lt_mul_of_le_of_lt_of_nonneg` / `one_lt_mul_of_le_of_lt` (still there) / `one_lt_mul` (still there)     |
| `Right.one_lt_mul₀`     | `Right.one_lt_mul_of_lt_of_lt`       |

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Split from #17593.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [d9ae6b8c2d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17623/commits/d9ae6b8c2dea29f676f73e5c3411422a323ed48b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Left.one_le_mul₀`
`+ Left.one_lt_mul_of_le_of_lt₀`
`+ Left.one_lt_mul_of_lt_of_le₀`
`+ Left.one_lt_mul₀`
`+ Right.one_le_mul₀`
`+ Right.one_lt_mul_of_le_of_lt₀`
`+ Right.one_lt_mul_of_lt_of_le₀`
`+ Right.one_lt_mul₀`
`+ mul_le_one_left₀`
`+ mul_le_one_right₀`
`+ mul_lt_one_of_le_of_lt_of_pos_left`
`+ mul_lt_one_of_le_of_lt_right₀`
`+ mul_lt_one_of_le_of_lt₀`
`+ mul_lt_one_of_lt_of_le_left₀`
`+ mul_lt_one_of_lt_of_le_of_pos_right`
`+ mul_lt_one_of_lt_of_le₀`
`+ one_lt_mul₀`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
</details>
The motivation is described in the PR description. All new lemmas have been suffixed with `₀` now.
I mean, your PR description describes *what* the PR is doing but not really the *why*

> Some lemmas are correctly named versions of existing lemmas,

Also I can't easily assert this claim because the existing lemmas don't show up in the diff. Could you please golf the existing lemmas with the new ones?

I've updated the PR description to show the corresponding old lemmas. They previously used the lemmas that will be deprecated in #17593. I can't change the proofs of some old lemmas because they don't assume `ZeroLEOneClass`. I can deprecate all the corresponding lemmas in this PR if needed.

> I've updated the PR description to show the corresponding old lemmas. They previously used the lemmas that will be deprecated in #17593. I can't change the proofs of some old lemmas because they don't assume `ZeroLEOneClass`. I can deprecate all the corresponding lemmas in this PR if needed.

Can you change the proofs of the old lemmas if you make them assume `ZeroLEOneClass`?

Sorry, it's still very hard for me to judge the new lemma names, because there are so many (In fact, I just spent an hour staring at them without spotting the pattern). I see two ways out:
1. Don't prove explicitly all the lemmas of this form, when they can be obtained from existing lemmas by transitivity with `a ≤ 1`/`b ≤ 1`/`a < 1`/`b < 1`. That would be my preferred option, because there are so many lemmas to be had that I doubt anyone will remember the names or even be able to find the lemma that suits their need when it arises. Other languages (eg Isabelle) have less lemmas and more powerful automation, and here it feels like you are pushing the "more lemmas" philosophy of mathlib unbearably far. Do you know about `bound`? I suspect it would make your need for these lemmas vanish.
2. Design a full nomenclature describing which lemma should be called what, adhere to it (in this PR and in existing lemmas) and include it in some module doc.

I'm just organizing existing lemmas, and these lemmas are just variants of `a ≤ 1 → b ≤ 1 → a * b ≤ 1` and `1 ≤ a → 1 ≤ b → 1 ≤ a * b`. We had some lemmas of this form a few years ago. The purpose of this PR is to improve the names of the existing lemmas (which are so bad that they are seldom used), and the new names follow the suggestions you gave in #9904 and here.

There are also similar lemmas in `Group/Unbundled`. The difference here is only that it may use `left / right` to specify which positivity proof should be provided.

I'm not insisting on keeping these theorems. But if we really don't need them, I think we'd better remove all existing variants. I don't think having only [`mul_le_one₀`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/GroupWithZero/Unbundled.html#mul_le_one%E2%82%80) is better than having `mul_le_one_left₀` and `mul_le_one_right₀`. If you think the new names are not good, I'm happy to change them to something better.

@FR-vdash-bot renames of many widespread low-level lemmas should generally begin with a Zulip discussion that develops a coherent action plan. Then reviewers can be pointed to that discussion to clarify questions about those renames that have already been answered. Please begin that discussion on Zulip and link to it from this PR.

These two PRs deal only with lemmas that were added when typeclasses `PosMulMono` was introduced. The old names mentioned in this PR description that will be deprecated are not even used at all in any other files in mathlib. (If they haven't been used recently. I will update this PR to show this by deprecating them.) The widespread lemmas are those introduced earlier for `OrderedSemiring`, and these two PRs do not deprecate these names.
What's your use case? Can you suffix ₀ everywhere?
What's your use case? Can you suffix ₀ everywhere?

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/Order/GroupWithZero/Unbundled): add some lemmas
